body.p: If a person develops kidney failure, predict how tissue osmolarity will be effected?

input.choice: There would be no effect, other systems would maintain osmolarity.
Body fluid osmolarity would likely change, but the direction is not predictable without other information.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is the main effector for regulation of body fluid osmolarity. People in kidney failure are at significant risk of imbalance, which will probably need to be corrected with dialysis.
Incorrect. It might increase, but is somewhat unpredictable, therefore this is not the best answer.
Incorrect. It might decrease, but is somewhat unpredictable, therefore this is not the best answer.
Correct. Depending on fluid intake and loss through other systems, as well as dietary solute intake, body fluid osmolarity might increase or decrease.

body.p: Which of the following is most likely to happen if cell number in a tissue is not regulated?

feedback.p: Correct. When cells are not able to regulate their number, a tumor can form.
Incorrect. An infection occurs when microorganisms invade body tissues and cause damage.

Incorrect. Nerves are made of cells called neurons, and if their numbers decrease, various problems might occur, but neurons do not typically divide by mitosis to maintain cell numbers, so this is not the best answer here.
Incorrect. Apoptosis is a programmed cell death that helps regulate cell number.

body.p: What can result from ingestion of unrestricted amounts of water?

input.choice: good health; water is good for you

feedback.p: Incorrect. Most people don’t consume enough water. However, too much of something can be as harmful as too little of it; that is why homeostasis maintains a "set point."
Incorrect. The body will have problems, but positive feedback loops will not occur; this is still a negative feedback process, but the effectors cannot keep up with the input.

Incorrect. Too much of something can be as harmful as too little of it; that is why homeostasis maintains a "set point." Too much water causes urination initially, but if the urinary system can’t process all of the fluid fast enough, the water will dilute the blood, cause parts of the body to swell, and ultimately inhibit brain function.

Correct. Too much of something can be as harmful as too little of it; that is why homeostasis maintains a "set point." Too much water causes urination initially, but if the urinary system can’t process all of the fluid fast enough, the water will dilute the blood, cause parts of the body to swell, and ultimately inhibit brain function.

body.p: What can happen if cell number in a tissue is not homeostatically maintained?

feedback.p: Correct. When cells are not able to regulate homeostasis, a tumor can form.
Incorrect. An infection occurs when foreign organisms enter a tissue or cell.
Incorrect. It’s possible that too much nerve death can lead to a loss of homeostasis, but usually nerve damage occurs from a cut.
Incorrect. Apoptosis is a programmed cell death that helps maintain homeostasis.

body.p: With Type I diabetes, the pancreas is not able to produce insulin, thus affecting the feedback communication from the pancreas that helps decrease blood glucose levels when they are too high. However the receptor cells and effectors still respond properly to insulin if it is provided, as by an injection or pump. What would be a comparable abnormality for the homeostatic feedback components that can lead to hypocalcemia (too low blood calcium levels)?

input.choice: the parathyroid gland doesn’t produce parathyroid hormone
the parathyroid sensor cells don’t detect drop in blood calcium
the kidney doesn’t respond to parathyroid hormone and continues to excrete calcium in the urine
the osteoclasts don’t respond to parathyroid hormone to release calcium from bone (cell death)

feedback.p: Correct. This rarely occurs unless the parathyroid gland is damaged or removed with thyroid gland surgery. Treatment usually involved Vitamin D and calcium supplements.
Incorrect. These cells would still detect the change, but their input would not initiate the communication to the effector.
Incorrect. The kidney would still respond to the hormone, so this would only happen if the level of hormone in blood is too low.
Incorrect. The bone cells would still respond to the hormone, so this would only happen if the level of hormone in blood is too low.

body.p: Even though a Type II diabetic’s pancreas is able to produce insulin, the body’s cells become less sensitive (insulin resistance), so cells are unable to effectively take glucose out of the blood and levels rise. At first the pancreas will actually make more insulin, but the insulin is not having a proper effect in the body to maintain blood glucose homeostasis.
What would be a comparable abnormality for the homeostatic feedback components that can lead to hypercalcemia (too high blood calcium levels)?

input.choice: the parathyroid gland doesn’t produce parathyroid hormone
the parathyroid gland produces too much parathyroid hormone
the kidney doesn’t respond to parathyroid hormone and continues to excrete excess calcium in the urine
the osteoclasts don’t respond to parathyroid hormone to release calcium from bone

feedback.p: Incorrect. This would lead to lower blood calcium levels, not higher.

Correct. This could happen if the parathyroid gland has a tumor, and would lead to increased blood calcium. This could cause kidney stones and osteoporosis, as well as heart and other problems over time.
Incorrect. If the kidney is excreting excess calcium the blood calcium levels would not rise.
Incorrect. If the osteoclasts do not release more calcium from bones the blood calcium levels would not rise.

body.p: One way to treat high blood pressure is with a diuretic. A diuretic increases the amount of fluid excreted by the kidneys in urine. This is correcting one part of the homoeostatic feedback mechanism for maintaining blood pressure. While this is not addressing the cause of the high blood pressure, it will help reduce blood pressure by:

feedback.p: Incorrect. This would cause the blood pressure to increase more.
Correct. As the blood volume is decreased, the blood pressure will be reduced, although other treatments are also needed to address the cause of the high blood pressure.
Incorrect. This would cause the blood pressure to increase more.
Incorrect. This would cause the blood pressure to increase more.

body.p: Predict which of the following would not be a likely problem if blood calcium homeostasis could not be maintained?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Hypocalcemia can lead to more parathyroid hormone production and stimulation of osteoclasts to release calcium from the bones, leaving them weaker.
Incorrect. Hypercalcemia can result in kidneys removing excess calcium from the blood and the formation of kidney stones.
Correct. Other ion imbalances, such as potassium, are linked to changes in breathing, but not hypocalcemia or hypocalcemia.
Incorrect. Because of calcium’s role in muscle contraction, either hypercalcemia or hypocalcemia can cause different heart problems.
